review: I have chronic pain due to Dystonia Torticollis in my neck, back and hands.  A neurological condition, it has affected my posture with tremors and pain. I have liver disease and the neuropathy that can go along with that disease.  I was on Hydrocodone.  After a few hospital visits for my liver, the doctor changed my med to Oxycodone (same milligrams of 7.5).  My husband cuts all of my 15 mg pills in half because there is no 7.5 Oxycodone.  This is done per the Doctor.  My pills are usually from Camber Pharma. They have the side affect of fatigue, no energy, wanting to sleep all day. Two months ago my pharmacy gave me the same pain pills from Amneal Pharma. They helped me.  Lasted longer than 1-2 hours compared to Camber pills.  I was not entirely exhausted all the time, helped control tremors.  By accident I found this info on the internet. You can request a generic Pharma to fill your prescriptions.  PA lists the Pharma initials on the script after the Mg. or call your pharmacy.

There was an issue at the pharmacy I use this month  so I went somewhere else and ended up with the Rhodes 30 mg oxycodone R P 30mg and these are absolutely horrible.  This is the second day and so far every time I take one of these I get nauseous and sometimes throw up a couple hours later.  It seems like something is not right about this medication.  It's not helping the pain very much and my body seems to be rejecting them.  Not sure what I'm going to do for now but I will NEVER get these again.  Looking forward to next month so I won't have to suffer anymore.

Xtampza ER (oxycodone):Have been on 40 mg ER of oxycontin 2 x a day along with ten  percocet 10/325 and many other drugs for severe chronic pain for 20+ years.  Was made to switch to Xtampza 36 ER 2x a day and 5 percocet.  The Xtampza er is worthless! Shame on whoever decides that a drug works or does not as every individual persons body is different as are their diseases. For people who are responsible and do not have a life without adequate pain relief, you are making us prisoners in our own bodies.  Even with OxyContin 40 ER 2x a day and all the other meds, most of us still suffer plenty.  I am not even 60 and can hardly move with new drug changes.  Have had over 40 surgeries and am full of hardware.  I do not like having to eat the high fat with Xtampza twice a day.  When you are in severe to debilitating pain, you have no appetite.  I am probably 10 pounds over weight but do not need to carry any more weight with eating high fat twice a day as I eat healthy.  Suicide rates will increase with this new drug
